title: Add more Debug information to LLM response errors
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Sometimes, the LLM does not return the expected JSON format, and I can't see the entire content to debug it.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like a way to see what message was sent and what the response was. Ideally, there should be more detailed debug information when the LLM response contains errors. I know that the logs contain a small message indicating that the LLM returned an incorrect JSON, but I don't think that shows the entire response. Additionally, I am unable to see the message that paperless-ai sent. It would be helpful to have a more comprehensive log that includes both the request and the full response for better debugging.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
None

**Additional context**
Repsonse from AI service: {
  document: { tags: [], correspondent: null },
  metrics: null,
  error: 'Invalid API response structure'
}

title: Ownership of created tags and correspondents
body:
## **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I am facing a recurring issue (#243 ) related to automatic ownership of tags and correspondents created by the dedicated user for AI analysis in Paperless. The problem is that these objects are automatically assigned to the dedicated user as the owner, which causes them to be marked as "Private" and, therefore, inaccessible to other users. This is a barrier to proper collaboration and usability.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to request a feature where the tags and correspondents created by the AI (or through the API) are not automatically assigned to the dedicated user as the owner. Instead, they could be created with open ownership by default, allowing other users to access them without restrictions. Furthermore, it would be nice if there was a setting that allows to define the permissions (ownership, user¬¥s and groups) for these objects in advance, providing more control over access and collaboration.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Currently, the only alternative is manually changing the ownership of the tags and correspondents after they are created, which is time-consuming and not an ideal solution for workflow efficiency.

**Additional context**
I'm not sure if the Paperless API supports these functions and whether it's feasible in terms of effort, as it seems that relatively few people are facing this issue.

title: Self signed certificate not accepted
body:
**Describe the bug**
Cannot setup with self signed certificate on paperless-ngx, even after updating ca-certificates and npm config set strict-ssl false inside container

**To Reproduce**
setup paperless-ai with a paperless-ngx instance, which has a self-signed certificate

**Expected behavior**
unfortunately looks like node does not use the system wide ca-certificates so even after adding my root ca cert to /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/ and issuing update-ca-certificates, it would still fail to validate the cert, i would have assumed that after this it would be able to validate the cert of paperless-ngx as a valid cert

**Additional context/workaround**
the error log inside the container states: Paperless validation error: unable to get local issuer certificate

i got it to work with disabling certificate verification in nodejs, with adding the below line to my docker-compose file:
```
    environment:
      - "NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0"
```

or if you have the root cert of the ca that signed your cert (you are your own ca and are self signing certs) then you can add your root ca cert like so:

```
    environment:
      - "NODE_EXTRA_CA_CERTS=</path/to/file>"
```

not sure what the solution could be, mostly created the report for documentation purposes, i am not experienced in nodejs development in the slightest

services:

title: Permissions for Tags and Correspondents
body:
Hi,

I've setup paperless with multiple users in private environment (household). I also created a dedicated API User for paperless-ai. In paperless frontend, I set permissions for newly created tags and correspondents to *no owner* and view and edit rights to my common group all users belong to. Furthermore, all documents are set to the same ownership/permissions by a workflow. With this setup, paperless-ai can process all documents either uploaded by any user or imported from consumption directory.

The problem now are the tags and correspondents created by paperless-ai. Unfortunately, the default ownership/permissions are only used, if objects are created via the web frontend, not if they are created via the API. Therefore, all newly created objects belong to the paperless-ai API User and the other users can't see them (they are displayed as private).

It would be great, if paperless-ai can read the ownership/permissions of the current document and uses them also for newly created tags and correspondents. This way, it would be guaranteed, that a user can access all tags and correspondents added to his documents.

Alternatively, paperless-ai can provide settings for ownership/permissions and uses them for all newly created objects.

Other thoughts and tricks are welcome. I just don't want to use one account for all members of our household. I think this will also be an interesting feature for small office groups.

Thanks for looking into it.
Stefan

comments.body:

> Default Permissions

title: Document has no content, skipping analysis
body:
**Describe the bug**
After a few hours of operation, a series of PDF documents (originating from emails) appears marked as "no content," causing Paperless AI to get stuck in a loop, repeatedly trying to parse the same documents.

**How to Reproduce**
Just have around 25 not parsable documents.

**Expected behavior**
The documents should be marked as unprocessable and skipped in the next loop.

title: Tried with Ollama and Deepseek-r1
body:
Hi,

So I was successful in setting everything up and I can chat with my ollama deepseek-r1 model via the paperless-ai gui.

However it has trouble analyzing the provided file (it is a pdf and the ocr from paperless was pretty spot on). It was able to read parts of it but couldn't manage to answer in more detail:

```
Alright, so I need to figure out what the document is talking about. The user greeted me in German and asked what's going on with it. I responded by saying that without seeing the content, I can't provide a specific answer.
Okay, since the user is asking about the topic of a document they provided earlier, but now it seems like there might be some confusion because the initial query didn't include an attachment or any specific details. Maybe the user sent the question after sending the document but didn't attach it properly, or perhaps they only included text.

I should make sure to inform them that I can't access external content and ask for more information. It's important to prompt them to provide specifics like headings, keywords, or key points from the document so I can assist better. Also, if there were images or charts, mentioning those would be helpful.

Maybe I'll phrase it in a friendly and supportive way to encourage them to share whatever details they have. That way, I can help them understand how to proceed or what information is needed for an accurate response.

Ihr Dokument seems to be about an unspecified topic since no specific content was provided. To assist you effectively, please provide more details such as the main subject, key points, headings, keywords, or any relevant context from your document. This will enable me to offer a more precise and helpful response.
```

After inquiring more I get this response:

```
Okay, so the user sent me this pretty detailed query about a Kia electric car and then added that they provided a document. Hmm, but when I look at their message, it's all in one block without any separation between their initial question and the additional info.
Wait, maybe they didn't realize how to format their messages properly here. They probably intended to ask something specific about the car details they provided. So my response should acknowledge that they included a document but also make sure I understand what exactly they need help with.

I should check if there's any specific information they want me to focus on, like the electric range, CO2 emissions, or maybe something else from the document. It seems they might be looking for assistance interpreting or analyzing the provided data about their Kia EV9.

Also, the user mentioned that the CO2 emissions are 0 g/km, which is interesting because traditional combustion engines have high CO2 output. So perhaps they're curious about why this is happening with an electric vehicle and what implications that has on fuel costs over time.

I should also consider if there's any regulatory information or tax benefits since the steuerbefreiung (tax holiday) was mentioned. The user might be looking into whether this car could save them money in taxes or running costs over a few years.

Another thing to think about is the upfront cost versus the long-term savings with an electric vehicle compared to a traditional one. Maybe they're evaluating if it's worth switching to electric based on their driving habits and budget.

I need to make sure my response is clear, friendly, and open-ended so they know I'm here to help them explore whatever aspects of the document they're interested in.

It seems you've provided a detailed document about a Kia EV9. However, your message appears to be a bit disjointed and may not have been formatted properly. Could you clarify or provide more specific details about what you'd like me to focus on? For example, are you asking for an interpretation of the data, an analysis, or something else related to this document? Let me know how I can assist!
```

With which models was paperless ai tested? Maybe deepseek just doesn't do a good job with it?
The response doesn't seem to be very good:

No tags or correspondent found in response from Ollama for Document.
Please review your prompt or switch to OpenAI for better results.

Realizing that Deepseek-r1 might be a bad choice for this I tested llama 3.1 with similar results.
It seems that the AI doesn't get the whole ocr'd document as a prompt

I think you do better to fix the error that's causing a 20min timeout not to be enough. 

That's clearly abnormal.

> That's clearly abnormal.

Well, you're right - this is abnormal. I'm using Ollama with gemm2 27b on a iGPU. I would not mind even if it runs for 60 min. at night, as long as the results are good.

gemma2:9b works okay, but produces bad results with some documents:
```
Extracted JSON String: {
  "title": "Abfallgeb√ºhrenbescheid",
  "date": "01.01.2025",
  "customer_name": null,
  "customer_address": null,
  "invoice_number": "5.XXXX.XXXXXX.1",
  "period": "2024-2025",
  "total_amount": "XX.XX ‚Ç¨",
  "payment_details": {
    "iban": "DEXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX",
    "bic": "PBNKDEFF700",
    "bank": "Postbank Ndi der Deutsche Bank"
  },
  "items": [
    {
      "description": "M√ºllgrundgeb√ºhr",
      "amount": "XX.00 ‚Ç¨",
      "period": "2025"
    }
Error parsing JSON from response: Expected ',' or ']' after array element in JSON at position 466 (line 19 column 6)
Attempting to sanitize the JSON...
Final JSON parsing failed after sanitization.
This happens when the JSON structure is too complex or invalid.
That indicates an issue with the generated JSON string by Ollama.
Switch to OpenAI for better results or fine tune your prompt.
No tags or correspondent found in response from Ollama for Document.
Please review your prompt or switch to OpenAI for better results.```

Sorry but the 20min timeout is more then enough. Running on a iGPU doesn't make any sense. I will give you the advice to switch your Ollama to use CPU instead of GPU. That will increase your speed already. A too small GPU bottlenecks more then just using CPU + RAM directly as GPU -> VRAM -> CACHE OUT TO RAM -> FILL VRAM - GPU PROCESSING and that in a loop over and over again.

So tldr:
If your GPU cant handle a prompt in under 20min just switch to a Cloud Provider or stock up your hardware.

title: Correspondent search failing to match multiple correspondents
body:
**Describe the bug**
Multiple correspondents are failing to be matched, even though they exist in Paperless. Paperless AI appears to correctly identify the correspondent, however when trying to retrieve the ID from the correspondent API, a 400 error is being returned.

**To Reproduce**

**Example 1:**
Correspondent name: "Virgin Media"
Paperless AI log entries:
 - Failed to process correspondent "Virgin Media": Request failed with status code 400
 - Error processing correspondent "Virgin Media": Request failed with status code 400

Paperless log entry:
 - [WARNING] [django.request] Bad Request: /api/correspondents/

If I query the Paperless API directly, the correct corespondent is found:
`GET /api/correspondents/?id__in=&id=&name__istartswith=&name__iendswith=&name__icontains=&name__iexact=Virgin+Media`

Returns:

````
HTTP 200 OK
Allow: GET, POST, HEAD, OPTIONS
Content-Type: application/json
Vary: Accept

{
    "count": 1,
    "next": null,
    "previous": null,
    "all": [
        97
    ],
    "results": [
        {
            "id": 97,
            "slug": "virgin-media",
            "name": "Virgin Media",
            "match": "",
            "matching_algorithm": 6,
            "is_insensitive": true,
            "document_count": 4,
            "owner": null,
            "user_can_change": true
        }
    ]
}
````

**Example 2:**
Correspondent name: "Petplan"
Paperless AI log entries:
 - Failed to process correspondent "Petplan": Request failed with status code 400
 - Error processing correspondent "Petplan": Request failed with status code 400

Paperless log entry:
 - [WARNING] [django.request] Bad Request: /api/correspondents/

If I query the Paperless API directly, the correct corespondent is found:
`GET /api/correspondents/?id__in=&id=&name__istartswith=&name__iendswith=&name__icontains=&name__iexact=Petplan`

Returns:

````
HTTP 200 OK
Allow: GET, POST, HEAD, OPTIONS
Content-Type: application/json
Vary: Accept

{
    "count": 1,
    "next": null,
    "previous": null,
    "all": [
        125
    ],
    "results": [
        {
            "id": 125,
            "slug": "petplan",
            "name": "Petplan",
            "match": "",
            "matching_algorithm": 6,
            "is_insensitive": true,
            "document_count": 1,
            "owner": 2,
            "user_can_change": true
        }
    ]
}
````

The correspondent is then not set for affected documents.

**Expected behavior**
I would expect the ID for the found correspondent to be returned, so that it can be passed through to the updated document.

**Additional context**
I have provided 2 examples above, but there are several more exhibiting the same behaviour. I can provide more details if required.

title: [Feature Request] Only use Existing Correspondents
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
If the AI is free to pick the correspondent, in some cases it will make small variations of the correspondent's name. E.g. [Apple] vs [Apple Inc]. This makes grouping the documents later much more difficult.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Like with the existing tags function, limit the AI to only use and consider the existing correspondents. If it cannot be found, allow for the option to add it to the title.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I have tested with sending a full list of the correspondents with the Prompt. It seems to help but it is not a full match.
author: CreekDuzz

comments.body:
Will implement this till the weekend including existing Tags. 

But bear in mind:
If you have thousands of correspondents and thousands of tags then the cost will explode tremendously.

Yes, you are right. I expect it will not reach those numbers in many cases. I have about 2700 documents collected since 2004 and have 90 correspondents. Yes, I did not include some of the one-off correspondents.

Nevertheless, I would pick higher quality output over a bit more cost.

Thank you!

@CreekDuzz 

You can already significantly improve the generation of corredpondents by expanding the prompt:

`When generating the corredpondent, always create the shortest possible form of the company name (e.g. "Amazon" instead of "Amazon EU SARL, German branch", [add further examples]).`

This already improves the accuracy immensely. 

Alternatively, you can specify the complete list of all allowed cortrdpondents in the prompt.
Thats a great tip! @thorschtn

I'll second this. My list of correspondents is very carefully curated. Letting OpenAI loose on creating new correspondents has created quite a large mess, duplicates etc. I'd prefer to be able to restrict Paperless AI to only select from existing correspondents when populating this field. Perhaps allow for adding new or suggested correspondents when manually processing files?

title: Display Version Number in /setup or Similar Interface
body:
**Description**

It would be highly beneficial to display the current version number of clusterzx/paperless-ai directly within the /setup page or a similar configuration/interface section. This feature would make it easier to identify the installed version without requiring command-line access or manual inspection of container logs.

**Proposed Feature**
	‚Ä¢	Add the current version number of the application to the /setup page or another easily accessible location within the web interface.
	‚Ä¢	Ensure that the version number updates automatically with each new release.

**Benefits**
	‚Ä¢	Simplifies version tracking for administrators and users.
	‚Ä¢	Facilitates troubleshooting by allowing quick verification of the installed version.
	‚Ä¢	Helps ensure that users are running the latest version without unnecessary guesswork.

**Additional Notes**

This feature could be implemented as a small addition to the /setup or a dedicated ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù page, making it non-intrusive yet highly effective.

**Thank you for the great work on this project! Your efforts are highly appreciated, and features like this will make an already excellent tool even better.**

title: Feature Request: Add Custom Tag to Processed Documents
body:
**Description**

Currently, clusterzx/paperless-ai processes new documents as expected. However, it is difficult to track which documents have already been processed by the tool. To improve oversight and control, I would like to request a feature where processed documents are assigned a user-definable tag.

**Proposed Feature**
	‚Ä¢	Add the ability to define a custom tag in the configuration.
	‚Ä¢	Automatically apply the tag to documents once they have been processed by the clusterzx/paperless-ai tool.

**Benefits**
	‚Ä¢	Provides clear visibility into which documents have been processed.
	‚Ä¢	Simplifies document management and avoids duplicate processing.
	‚Ä¢	Enables users to create workflows or filters based on the assigned tag.

**Example Use Case**
	1.	A document is processed by clusterzx/paperless-ai.
	2.	The tool applies a tag, e.g., ai-processed, to the document in PaperlessNGX.
	3.	Users can filter documents in PaperlessNGX to see which have been processed and which have not.

**Additional Notes**
This feature could be implemented as an optional setting, allowing users to enable or disable it based on their preferences.

I've found that ollama came up with nonsensical correspondent names (akin to ACME Corp, ABC Industries etc).
Upon inspection it seems like the document information is not appended to the prompt at all so in retrospective the behaviour does make sense. 

Fun fact, no errors were seen in the logs when using mistral as a model. After switching to llama3.2, the LLM's reply actually mentions it's not able to build the requested output since the input is missing.
author: fstolba

comments.body:
Oh wow you are absolutely right with that. 

I forgot to add the content part to the prompt after reworking the ollamaService. 

Thanks for your valuable input. I really appreciate that.
